question.title: Which Selenium WebDriver version for which Chrome version?
question.body:
I do not understand which versions fit together here. Currently I use:

<dependency>
    <groupId>org.seleniumhq.selenium</groupId>
    <artifactId>selenium-java</artifactId>
    <version>4.21.0</version> 
</dependency>

and in my Dockerfile:

FROM selenium/standalone-chrome:125.0

As far as I understand the WebDriver (part of selenium-java) for Chrome must somehow match the Chrome version.

Any insights welcome...

answers.body:
Selenium requires the ChromeDriver version to match the major version of the Chrome browser.

For example:

  • Chrome 122.x.xxxx.xxx â†’ Needs ChromeDriver v122

You can check compatibility here:

  • Official ChromeDriver version page:
    https://chromedriver.chromium.org/downloads

It lists which ChromeDriver supports which Chrome versions.

There are 3 pieces here:

  1. Selenium WebDriver - the guts of Selenium. It provides the API that you use to control the browser. You can use whichever version you want but ideally you are using the newest version available to get all the latest functionality, bug fixes, etc. The current version is 4.31.0, see https://www.selenium.dev/downloads/.
  2. Browser driver (ChromeDriver, geckodriver, etc.) - the driver that allows Selenium to talk to the browser it's controlling. You must use the driver version that corresponds to the installed browser version (see #3).
  3. The installed browser (Chrome, Firefox, etc.) - the browser that will be used for your Selenium script.

On additional thing to consider is Selenium Manager. As of Selenium 4.6, Selenium Manager was added and it automatically takes care of downloading and configuring the appropriate driver for you. So, you no longer need to use a DriverManager or specify the path, etc. This makes starting up the correct driver as simple as...

WebDriver driver = new ChromeDriver();
driver.get("https://www.selenium.dev/documentation/selenium_manager/");
// do something
driver.quit();
